1.verse: The proverbs of Solomon son of David, king of Israel:

2.verse: for gaining wisdom and instruction;

3.verse: for receiving instruction in prudent behavior,

4.verse: for giving prudence to those who are simple,

5.verse: let the wise listen and add to their learning,

6.verse: for understanding proverbs and parables,

7.verse: The fear of the Lord is the beginning of knowledge,

8.verse: Listen, my son, to your father’s instruction

9.verse: They are a garland to grace your head

10.verse: My son, if sinful men entice you,

11.verse: If they say, “Come along with us;

12.verse: let’s swallow them alive, like the grave,

13.verse: we will get all sorts of valuable things

14.verse: cast lots with us;

15.verse: my son, do not go along with them,

16.verse: for their feet rush into evil,

17.verse: How useless to spread a net

18.verse: These men lie in wait for their own blood;

19.verse: Such are the paths of all who go after ill-gotten gain;

20.verse: Out in the open wisdom calls aloud,

21.verse: on top of the wall she cries out,

22.verse: “How long will you who are simple love your simple ways?

23.verse: Repent at my rebuke!

24.verse: But since you refuse to listen when I call

25.verse: since you disregard all my advice

26.verse: I in turn will laugh when disaster strikes you;

27.verse: when calamity overtakes you like a storm,

28.verse: “Then they will call to me but I will not answer;

30.verse: Since they would not accept my advice

31.verse: they will eat the fruit of their ways

32.verse: For the waywardness of the simple will kill them,

33.verse: but whoever listens to me will live in safety

1.verse: My son, if you accept my words

2.verse: turning your ear to wisdom

3.verse: indeed, if you call out for insight

4.verse: and if you look for it as for silver

5.verse: then you will understand the fear of the Lord

6.verse: For the Lord gives wisdom;

7.verse: He holds success in store for the upright,

8.verse: for he guards the course of the just

9.verse: Then you will understand what is right and just

10.verse: For wisdom will enter your heart,

11.verse: Discretion will protect you,

12.verse: Wisdom will save you from the ways of wicked men,

13.verse: who have left the straight paths

14.verse: who delight in doing wrong

15.verse: whose paths are crooked

16.verse: Wisdom will save you also from the adulterous woman,

17.verse: who has left the partner of her youth

18.verse: Surely her house leads down to death

19.verse: None who go to her return

20.verse: Thus you will walk in the ways of the good

21.verse: For the upright will live in the land,

22.verse: but the wicked will be cut off from the land,

1.verse: My son, do not forget my teaching,

2.verse: for they will prolong your life many years

3.verse: Let love and faithfulness never leave you;

4.verse: Then you will win favor and a good name

5.verse: Trust in the Lord with all your heart

6.verse: in all your ways submit to him,

7.verse: Do not be wise in your own eyes;

8.verse: This will bring health to your body

9.verse: Honor the Lord with your wealth,

10.verse: then your barns will be filled to overflowing,

11.verse: My son, do not despise the Lord ’s discipline,

12.verse: because the Lord disciplines those he loves,

13.verse: Blessed are those who find wisdom,

14.verse: for she is more profitable than silver

15.verse: She is more precious than rubies;

16.verse: Long life is in her right hand;

17.verse: Her ways are pleasant ways,

18.verse: She is a tree of life to those who take hold of her;

19.verse: By wisdom the Lord laid the earth’s foundations,

20.verse: by his knowledge the watery depths were divided,

21.verse: My son, do not let wisdom and understanding out of your sight,

22.verse: they will be life for you,

23.verse: Then you will go on your way in safety,

24.verse: When you lie down, you will not be afraid;

25.verse: Have no fear of sudden disaster

26.verse: for the Lord will be at your side

27.verse: Do not withhold good from those to whom it is due,

28.verse: Do not say to your neighbor,

29.verse: Do not plot harm against your neighbor,

30.verse: Do not accuse anyone for no reason—

32.verse: For the Lord detests the perverse

33.verse: The Lord ’s curse is on the house of the wicked,

1.verse: Listen, my sons, to a father’s instruction;

2.verse: I give you sound learning,

3.verse: For I too was a son to my father,

4.verse: Then he taught me, and he said to me,

5.verse: Get wisdom, get understanding;

6.verse: Do not forsake wisdom, and she will protect you;

7.verse: The beginning of wisdom is this: Get wisdom.

8.verse: Cherish her, and she will exalt you;

9.verse: She will give you a garland to grace your head

10.verse: Listen, my son, accept what I say,

11.verse: I instruct you in the way of wisdom

12.verse: When you walk, your steps will not be hampered;

13.verse: Hold on to instruction, do not let it go;

14.verse: Do not set foot on the path of the wicked

15.verse: Avoid it, do not travel on it;

16.verse: For they cannot rest until they do evil;

17.verse: They eat the bread of wickedness

18.verse: The path of the righteous is like the morning sun,

19.verse: But the way of the wicked is like deep darkness;

20.verse: My son, pay attention to what I say;

21.verse: Do not let them out of your sight,

22.verse: for they are life to those who find them

23.verse: Above all else, guard your heart,

24.verse: Keep your mouth free of perversity;

25.verse: Let your eyes look straight ahead;

26.verse: Give careful thought to the paths for your feet

27.verse: Do not turn to the right or the left;

1.verse: My son, pay attention to my wisdom,

2.verse: that you may maintain discretion

3.verse: For the lips of the adulterous woman drip honey,

4.verse: but in the end she is bitter as gall,

5.verse: Her feet go down to death;

6.verse: She gives no thought to the way of life;

7.verse: Now then, my sons, listen to me;

8.verse: Keep to a path far from her,

9.verse: lest you lose your honor to others

10.verse: lest strangers feast on your wealth

11.verse: At the end of your life you will groan,

12.verse: You will say, “How I hated discipline!

13.verse: I would not obey my teachers

14.verse: And I was soon in serious trouble

15.verse: Drink water from your own cistern,

16.verse: Should your springs overflow in the streets,

17.verse: Let them be yours alone,

18.verse: May your fountain be blessed,

19.verse: A loving doe, a graceful deer —

20.verse: Why, my son, be intoxicated with another man’s wife?

21.verse: For your ways are in full view of the Lord ,

22.verse: The evil deeds of the wicked ensnare them;

23.verse: For lack of discipline they will die,

1.verse: My son, if you have put up security for your neighbor,

2.verse: you have been trapped by what you said,

3.verse: So do this, my son, to free yourself,

4.verse: Allow no sleep to your eyes,

5.verse: Free yourself, like a gazelle from the hand of the hunter,

6.verse: Go to the ant, you sluggard;

7.verse: It has no commander,

8.verse: yet it stores its provisions in summer

9.verse: How long will you lie there, you sluggard?

10.verse: A little sleep, a little slumber,

11.verse: and poverty will come on you like a thief

12.verse: A troublemaker and a villain,

13.verse: who winks maliciously with his eye,

14.verse: who plots evil with deceit in his heart—

15.verse: Therefore disaster will overtake him in an instant;

16.verse: There are six things the Lord hates,

17.verse: haughty eyes,

18.verse: a heart that devises wicked schemes,

19.verse: a false witness who pours out lies

20.verse: My son, keep your father’s command

21.verse: Bind them always on your heart;

22.verse: When you walk, they will guide you;

23.verse: For this command is a lamp,

24.verse: keeping you from your neighbor’s wife,

25.verse: Do not lust in your heart after her beauty

26.verse: For a prostitute can be had for a loaf of bread,

27.verse: Can a man scoop fire into his lap

28.verse: Can a man walk on hot coals

29.verse: So is he who sleeps with another man’s wife;

30.verse: People do not despise a thief if he steals

31.verse: Yet if he is caught, he must pay sevenfold,

32.verse: But a man who commits adultery has no sense;

33.verse: Blows and disgrace are his lot,

34.verse: For jealousy arouses a husband’s fury,

35.verse: He will not accept any compensation;

1.verse: My son, keep my words

2.verse: Keep my commands and you will live;

3.verse: Bind them on your fingers;

4.verse: Say to wisdom, “You are my sister,”

5.verse: They will keep you from the adulterous woman,

6.verse: At the window of my house

7.verse: I saw among the simple,

8.verse: He was going down the street near her corner,

9.verse: at twilight, as the day was fading,

10.verse: Then out came a woman to meet him,

11.verse: (She is unruly and defiant,

12.verse: now in the street, now in the squares,

13.verse: She took hold of him and kissed him

14.verse: “Today I fulfilled my vows,

15.verse: So I came out to meet you;

16.verse: I have covered my bed

17.verse: I have perfumed my bed

18.verse: Come, let’s drink deeply of love till morning;

19.verse: My husband is not at home;

20.verse: He took his purse filled with money

21.verse: With persuasive words she led him astray;

22.verse: All at once he followed her

23.verse: till an arrow pierces his liver,

24.verse: Now then, my sons, listen to me;

25.verse: Do not let your heart turn to her ways

26.verse: Many are the victims she has brought down;

27.verse: Her house is a highway to the grave,

1.verse: Does not wisdom call out?

2.verse: At the highest point along the way,

3.verse: beside the gate leading into the city,

4.verse: “To you, O people, I call out;

5.verse: You who are simple, gain prudence;

6.verse: Listen, for I have trustworthy things to say;

7.verse: My mouth speaks what is true,

8.verse: All the words of my mouth are just;

9.verse: To the discerning all of them are right;

10.verse: Choose my instruction instead of silver,

11.verse: for wisdom is more precious than rubies,

12.verse: “I, wisdom, dwell together with prudence;

13.verse: To fear the Lord is to hate evil;

14.verse: Counsel and sound judgment are mine;

15.verse: By me kings reign

16.verse: by me princes govern,

17.verse: I love those who love me,

18.verse: With me are riches and honor,

19.verse: My fruit is better than fine gold;

20.verse: I walk in the way of righteousness,

21.verse: bestowing a rich inheritance on those who love me

22.verse: “The Lord brought me forth as the first of his works,

23.verse: I was formed long ages ago,

24.verse: When there were no watery depths, I was given birth,

25.verse: before the mountains were settled in place,

26.verse: before he made the world or its fields

27.verse: I was there when he set the heavens in place,

28.verse: when he established the clouds above

29.verse: when he gave the sea its boundary

30.verse: Then I was constantly at his side.

32.verse: “Now then, my children, listen to me;

33.verse: Listen to my instruction and be wise;

34.verse: Blessed are those who listen to me,

35.verse: For those who find me find life

36.verse: But those who fail to find me harm themselves;

1.verse: Wisdom has built her house;

2.verse: She has prepared her meat and mixed her wine;

3.verse: She has sent out her servants, and she calls

4.verse: “Let all who are simple come to my house!”

5.verse: “Come, eat my food

6.verse: Leave your simple ways and you will live;

7.verse: Whoever corrects a mocker invites insults;

8.verse: Do not rebuke mockers or they will hate you;

9.verse: Instruct the wise and they will be wiser still;

10.verse: The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom,

11.verse: For through wisdom your days will be many,

12.verse: If you are wise, your wisdom will reward you;

13.verse: Folly is an unruly woman;

14.verse: She sits at the door of her house,

15.verse: calling out to those who pass by,

16.verse: “Let all who are simple come to my house!”

17.verse: “Stolen water is sweet;

18.verse: But little do they know that the dead are there,

1.verse: The proverbs of Solomon:

2.verse: Ill-gotten treasures have no lasting value,

3.verse: The Lord does not let the righteous go hungry,

11.verse: The mouth of the righteous is a fountain of life,

12.verse: Hatred stirs up conflict,

13.verse: Wisdom is found on the lips of the discerning,

14.verse: The wise store up knowledge,

15.verse: The wealth of the rich is their fortified city,

18.verse: Whoever conceals hatred with lying lips

19.verse: Sin is not ended by multiplying words,

20.verse: The tongue of the righteous is choice silver,

21.verse: The lips of the righteous nourish many,

22.verse: The blessing of the Lord brings wealth,

26.verse: As vinegar to the teeth and smoke to the eyes,

28.verse: The prospect of the righteous is joy,

29.verse: The way of the Lord is a refuge for the blameless,

31.verse: From the mouth of the righteous comes the fruit of wisdom,

1.verse: The Lord detests dishonest scales,

2.verse: When pride comes, then comes disgrace,

5.verse: The righteousness of the blameless makes their paths straight,

6.verse: The righteousness of the upright delivers them,

8.verse: The righteous person is rescued from trouble,

9.verse: With their mouths the godless destroy their neighbors,

10.verse: When the righteous prosper, the city rejoices;

12.verse: Whoever derides their neighbor has no sense,

13.verse: A gossip betrays a confidence,

15.verse: Whoever puts up security for a stranger will surely suffer,

16.verse: A kindhearted woman gains honor,

17.verse: Those who are kind benefit themselves,

18.verse: A wicked person earns deceptive wages,

19.verse: Truly the righteous attain life,

20.verse: The Lord detests those whose hearts are perverse,

21.verse: Be sure of this: The wicked will not go unpunished,

22.verse: Like a gold ring in a pig’s snout

23.verse: The desire of the righteous ends only in good,

24.verse: One person gives freely, yet gains even more;

25.verse: A generous person will prosper;

26.verse: People curse the one who hoards grain,

27.verse: Whoever seeks good finds favor,
